meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of ambrosia, the food of the gods in Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: The ambrosian aroma of the freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The ambrosian nectar was said to grant immortality to those who consumed it.
meanings.sent3: The picnic felt truly ambrosian with the delicious spread of fruits and cheeses.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an ambrosian quality that captivated all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The ambrosian sunset painted the sky in hues of gold and pink.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to Ambrose, a 4th-century bishop of Milan.
meanings.sent1: The ambrosian teachings of Bishop Ambrose inspired many followers.
meanings.sent2: The ambrosian legacy of Ambrose continues to influence the church to this day.
meanings.sent3: The ambrosian statue of Bishop Ambrose in the square was a popular tourist attraction.
meanings.sent4: His wisdom was like an ambrosian fountain, quenching the thirst for knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The ambrosian spirit of Ambrose guided the city through times of trouble.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Ambrosian rite, a liturgical rite used in the Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The ambrosian chants during the ceremony filled the church with reverence.
meanings.sent2: The ambrosian vestments worn by the priests were intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to perform an ambrosian dance around the altar during the service.
meanings.sent4: The ambrosian rituals of the rite brought a sense of peace to the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The ambrosian atmosphere of the church made worship a truly sacred experience.
